chemoreception.notes: Sponges lack a nervous system, but possess chemoreceptors enabling them to detect chemical signals in the water for feeding, reproduction, and defense.

mechanoreception.notes: Sponges can detect water flow and physical stimuli via specialized cells, although details are not readily available at the family level.

light_sensitivity.notes: Photosensitivity has been demonstrated in some sponges, but its prevalence and function in Spirastrellidae are unknown.
